Posts.Title: Passport Photo

Posts.Content: Hi Niknic Last August I was diagnosed with aggressive stage 3 cancer with lymph nodes involved.I had CT scan and bone scans to check spread.luckily nothing was found. I know exactly how you are feeling.so scared I learned to cry in private (the shower is a good place no one can hear you )you will soon learn to put the smile on in public I had chemo first then mastectomy followed by radiotherapy it's along haul but it is do able.I am now waiting until September for CT scan trying not to think of the what ifs. As others have said it is a roller coaster scarey but just hold on  Feel free to message me if you have any questions
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - feel like I'm living a nightmare

Posts.Content: Hi sorry to hear your mum is having such a tough time.Do you have a Maggies centre near you I discovered the one in Edinburgh when I had my radiotherapy.The staff there were amazing some actually trained in oncology.They have access to counselors or you can just pop in for coffee and a chat.I'm sure all Maggies are the same.they also offer online advice
Posts.Title: Mums Diagnosis- Chemo Advice

Posts.Content: Well done Nette 70.the first time is the worst.I always wore my wig when I went out couldn't stand the pity looks if I wore a scarf.Once my hair started to grow back I went to places where no one would know me I realised no one noticed.I went to a party and a good friend did not recognise me she seriously had to ask who I was.it really made me laugh she was mortified.I have to add my hair used to be mousey brown my wig was brown with blonde highlights and the new pixie look is pure white!!!!!!sometimes don't recognise myself.
